intro: Azorella philippii, commonly known as the Andean mat, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its dense, low-growing mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers during the summer months. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in rocky or alpine regions. Azorella philippii is adapted to cold climates and can survive in nutrient-poor soils.
